title: Red Receives the Urgent Letter
summary: Red Riding Hood's mother gives her a basket of medicine and a letter, instructing her to deliver them to her ailing grandmother. Despite her mother's warnings about the dangers of the forest, Red decides to take the shortcut path, determined to arrive quickly and prove her maturity.

title: The Encounter at the Crossroads
summary: Red meets Lucas, the charming woodcutter, at the forest crossroads. Lucas warns her about a wolf that's been seen nearby and offers to escort her, but Red declines, wanting to impress her grandmother by completing the journey alone. Lucas, intrigued by Red's confidence, decides to follow her discreetly.

title: Wolf’s Deceptive Invitation
summary: The cunning Wolf intercepts Red, pretending to be a lost traveler. He engages her in flirtatious conversation, subtly extracting the location of her grandmother's cottage. After Red leaves, the Wolf decides to reach the cottage first to execute his plan and win Red's affection through deceit.

title: Wolf Arrives at the Cottage
summary: The Wolf arrives at Grandmother's house, locks Grandmother in a closet, and disguises himself in her clothing. He prepares tea and anxiously awaits Red, intent on impressing her with his wit and charm while hiding his true identity.

title: Red’s Suspicious Reunion
summary: Red arrives and starts noticing oddities in 'Grandmother's' behavior and appearance. She questions the Wolf, leading to a tense exchange where Red cleverly tests his responses. Sensing danger, Red pretends to faint, buying time as Lucas approaches the cottage, alerted by suspicious noises.

title: Lucas Confronts the Wolf
summary: Lucas bursts into the cottage, demanding the Wolf reveal himself. The Wolf, cornered, tries to persuade Red to leave with him, claiming they could be happy together. Red decisively rejects the Wolf, and Lucas subdues him, freeing Grandmother from the closet.

title: The Confession in the Clearing
summary: After the ordeal, Lucas confesses his feelings for Red and explains why he followed her. Red, moved by his sincerity and bravery, admits she admires him too. They agree to visit Grandmother together and start a more honest relationship.
